intro: Wahlenbergia ramosissima subsp. centiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight hairy texture. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers and ecological importance to local pollinators.
